content: Simply put, profits drive purpose — and as we used to say at Patagonia, we can’t drive our purpose without being profitable. However, growing for growth’s sake can get companies into trouble. We have seen entrepreneurs lose sight of the basics (i.e. sustained growth built on sound economic fundamentals), and the results are damaging to both purpose and profit. Patagonia has been a great example, where the company has grown significantly from the time I started, both financially and with the sustainability practices that have permeated the industry and far beyond.
